1.quote: The reward of suffering is experience.
1.author: Harry S Truman

2.quote: You have to make it happen.
2.author: Denis Diderot

3.quote: If I had to live my life again, I'd make the same mistakes, only sooner.
3.author: Tallulah Bankhead

4.quote: The best way to cheer yourself up is to try to cheer somebody else up.
4.author: Mark Twain

5.quote: It is not length of life, but depth of life.
5.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

6.quote: Blessed are the hearts that can bend; they shall never be broken.
6.author: Albert Camus

7.quote: It is certain, in any case, that ignorance, allied with power, is the most ferocious enemy justice can have.
7.author: James A. Baldwin

8.quote: Emancipate yourselves from mental slavery, none but ourselves can free our minds!
8.author: Marcus Garvey

9.quote: It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues.
9.author: Abraham Lincoln

10.quote: You will never win if you never begin.
10.author: Helen Rowland

11.quote: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.
11.author: Carol Burnett

12.quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
12.author: Socrates

13.quote: Love is when the other person's happiness is more important than your own.
13.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

14.quote: To be a Negro in this country and to be relatively conscious is to be in a rage almost all the time.
14.author: James A. Baldwin

16.quote: We all have ability. The difference is how we use it.
16.author: Charlotte Whitton

17.quote: Words, once they are printed, have a life of their own.
17.author: Carol Burnett

18.quote: How people treat you is their karma; how you react is yours.
18.author: Wayne Dyer

19.quote: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
19.author: Euripides

20.quote: We don't stop going to school when we graduate.
20.author: Carol Burnett

21.quote: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. 'Til your good is better and your better is best.
21.author: St. Jerome

22.quote: We should not give up and we should not allow the problem to defeat us.
22.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

23.quote: When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves.
23.author: William Arthur Ward

24.quote: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.
24.author: William Butler Yeats
